A business analyst is communicating business analysis information to resource managers via email every Monday as per the stakeholder engagement approach. Those same resource managers contact the BA every week about information that was already emailed. What should the business analyst do to resolve this breakdown in communication?

options.A: Replace the emails with weekly meetings and minutes that can be referenced after the meeting.
options.B: Begin scheduling weekly conference calls to provide a forum for follow-up discussion.
options.C: Refer the resource managers to the email.
options.D: Engage the source managers to understand if email is an effective mode of communication.

question: The approach that defines how requirements will be re-used is the:

options.D: approach to identifying business analysis improvements.

question: Which of the following accurately describes a stakeholderâ€™s role during future state analysis?

options.A: A regulator would ensure an envisioned future state can be sufficiently tested and can help set an appropriate level of quality to target.
options.B: An end user would help determine which business needs to address and sets the business objective that a future state will achieve.
options.C: A domain subject matter expert would provide insight into current state and potential states
options.D: A project manager would be directly involved in supporting the operations of the enterprise.
